channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Hedges, 12th August
item.description:
Need cutting Not been done for a while again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 34 Willowleaze, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 18 inch by 10 inch pot hole, 11th August
item.description:
18 inch by 10 inch pot hole in the middle of the road - The nearest house is number 1. This is not a particulary deep hole as such but its enough to warrant a repair. There are several smaller pot holes in close proximity to this one so could they be investigated and filled too please ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Bibury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water flowing down street from carwash, 10th August
item.description:
Contaminated Water is flowing down the street from the hand car wash in to the rain drains. This Water needs to be collected and process correctly. Will be a further hazard once winter arrives.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Caledonian Inn, 60 Swindon Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown verges and hedges, 10th August
item.description:
Trees, brambles, nettles, shrubs are overhanging into path of vehicles on Dog Lane. There is no room for pedestrians, cyclists, horse riders to get out of the way of vehicles, or for vehicles to pass each other

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Dog Lane, Witcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees and bushes, 9th August
item.description:
The footpath from Murvagh Close to Sandford Road is overgrown and almost impassable in parts.Would somebody please cut back the problem areas.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 36 Murvagh Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass in basketball area of park, 9th August
item.description:
Broken glass on the black surface of the basketball court in the park (there may also be some on the green surface and perhaps in the grass now). Also an abandoned B&M shopping trolley in the same park. However the broken glass shards are more of concern and a danger to children.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18 Newdawn Place, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
